jwblangley.neat.evolution

Class Evolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • jwblangley.neat.evolution.Evolution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProtoEquivalent

    public class Evolution
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProtoEquivalent
    Class to control the evolution and growth of neural network at the core of the NEAT algorithm

    • Constructor Detail

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(int populationSize,
                 int targetNumSpecies,
                 NetworkGenotype startingGenotype,
                 InnovationGenerator innovationGenerator,
                 int numThreads,
                 SingleEvaluator singleEvaluator)
        Construct a new Evolution object with single evaluator
        Parameters:
        populationSize - size of the population for each generation
        targetNumSpecies - number of targeted species in the population
        startingGenotype - genotype for the initial population to be filled with
        innovationGenerator - Generator for innovation markers
        singleEvaluator - Function to simulate and evaluate a single genotype
        numThreads - Number of concurrent threads to evaluate the population with

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(int populationSize,
                 int targetNumSpecies,
                 NetworkGenotype startingGenotype,
                 InnovationGenerator innovationGenerator,
                 BulkEvaluator bulkEvaluator)
        Construct a new Evolution object with bulk evaluator
        Parameters:
        populationSize - size of the population for each generation
        targetNumSpecies - number of targeted species in the population
        startingGenotype - genotype for the initial population to be filled with
        innovationGenerator - Generator for innovation markers
        bulkEvaluator - Function to simulate and evaluate a list of genotypes

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(jwblangley.neat.proto.EvolutionOuterClass.Evolution protoEvolution,
                 int targetNumSpecies,
                 int numThreads,
                 SingleEvaluator singleEvaluator)
        Create a new Evolution object from a protobuf object At least one call to evolve on the new object must happen before statistics are available
        Parameters:
        protoEvolution - protobuf object to create from
        targetNumSpecies - number of targeted species in the population
        numThreads - Number of concurrent threads to evaluate the population with
        singleEvaluator - Function to simulate and evaluate a single genotype

      • setVerbose

        public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
        Set verbose mode. In verbose mode, generation number, highest fitness and number of species are reported to stdout after each generation is evaluated. Verbose mode is initially disabled
        Parameters:
        verbose - whether verbose mode should be enabled

      • getNumberOfSpecies

        public int getNumberOfSpecies()
        Returns:
        The current number of species in the population

      • getHighestFitness

        public double getHighestFitness()
        Returns:
        The current highest fitness achieved by a member of the population

      • getFittestGenotype

        public NetworkGenotype getFittestGenotype()
        Returns:
        The genotype responsible for achieving the current highest fitness in the population

      • evolve

        public void evolve(java.util.Random random)
        Sort a generation into species, evaluate each member of the generation, kill off weaker members, generate child members from surviving members repopulate generation
        Parameters:
        random - seeded Random object. If you care about seeded behaviour, do not use the same random object here as in you evaluator. Due to thread pooling that will yield inconsistent results.
